ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
The Ninth Foundation: The knowledge that He, exalted is He, while being free from form and magnitude, sanctified from directions and dimensions, is visible to the eyes and sights in the Abode of the Hereafter, the Abode of Settlement, due to His saying, exalted is He: 'Faces (Wujuh) on that day will be radiant (Nadhirah), looking (Nathirah) at their Lord.' And I wonder how the Mu'tazilite knew from the attributes of the Lord of lords what Musa, peace be upon him, was ignorant of, and how Musa, peace be upon him, asked for vision (Ru'yah) while it is impossible. Perhaps the ignorance of the people of innovation (Bid'ah) and desires (Ahwa') from the ignorant fools is more appropriate than the ignorance of the prophets, prayers of Allah be upon them. As for the aspect of applying the verse of vision (Ru'yah) according to its apparent meaning, it is that it does not lead to impossibility, for vision (Ru'yah) is a type of unveiling (Kashf) and knowledge ('Ilm), except that it is more complete and clearer than knowledge ('Ilm). So if it is permissible for knowledge ('Ilm) to relate to Him while He is not in a direction, then it is permissible for vision (Ru'yah) to relate to Him while He is not in a direction. And just as it is permissible for Allah, exalted is He, to see the creation while not being opposite to them, it is permissible for the creation to see Him without opposition. And just as it is permissible to know without modality (Kayfiyyah) and form (Surah), it is permissible to see likewise.

And indeed, the weakening of the inner selves (Al-Bawatin) from the strength of certainty (Al-Yaqin) and belief (Al-Tasdiq) in the resurrection (Al-Ba'th) and the raising up (Al-Nushur) is due to the lack of understanding in this world of such matters. Then he was a clinging clot (Alaqatan), so He created and proportioned. And made from him the two mates, the male and the female.' So in the creation of the human being (Al-Adami), with the abundance of its wonders and the difference in the composition of its limbs, are wonders that exceed the wonders in his resurrection (Ba'thihi) and his restoration (I'adatihi). So how can one deny that from the power (Qudrat) of Allah the Exalted and His wisdom (Hikmatihi) who witnesses that in His making (Sina'atihi) and His power (Qudratihi)? So if there is weakness in your faith (Imanika), then strengthen the faith (Al-Iman) by looking at the first creation (Al-Nash'at Al-Ula), for the second is like it and easier than it. And if you are strong in faith (Qawi Al-Iman) in it, then make your heart (Qalbika) feel those fears (Al-Makhawif) and dangers (Al-Akhtar), and increase in it reflection (Al-Tafakkur) and consideration (Al-I'tibar), so that it may strip from your heart (Qalbika) the comfort (Al-Raha) and the settlement (Al-Qarar), and you become occupied with preparing for the presentation before the Compeller (Al-Jabbar).
